Yes, the Sri Lankan government has implemented various initiatives to help support the communities affected by the decline in tourism. Here are some examples:

1. Financial assistance: The government has provided financial assistance to businesses in the tourism sector, including low-interest loans and grants, to help them stay afloat during the downturn.

2. Tax incentives: The government has also provided tax incentives to tourism-related businesses to keep them operational, which also helps to protect jobs.

3. Stimulus packages: The Sri Lankan government has implemented stimulus packages to help boost the economy and support industries affected by the decline in tourism.

4. Domestic tourism campaigns: The government has launched domestic tourism campaigns to encourage Sri Lankan citizens to travel within the country, which helps to support tourism-related businesses.

5. Skill development programs: The government has also launched skill development programs to help people who have lost their jobs in the tourism sector to learn new skills and find employment in other sectors.

These initiatives are aimed at reducing the economic impact of the decline in tourism on local communities and supporting the industry's recovery.
